intro: Pristimera andongensis, commonly known as the Andong starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North Korea. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has small, elliptical leaves with a hairy surface. It is known for its ornamental value and has been the subject of botanical study due to its limited distribution. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this endangered species from habitat loss.
